screenshots.label: SRS Overview
screenshots.description:
Table on top: number of vocabulary items per level in total (grey) and ready for review (red).
Bottom diagram: number of vocabulary items scheduled for review in the near future.

screenshots.label:
Managing
SRS schemes
screenshots.description: Each language can use a different set of customizable time intervals for spaced repetition.

screenshots.label: Vocabulary lists
screenshots.description:
View, search and modify vocabulary items using the left column.
Create lists in the middle column and view their content on the right.

screenshots.label:
Dictionary
(currently only
for Japanese)
screenshots.description: Search for words using their meanings or on/kun-yomi (supports wilcards).

screenshots.label:
Adding words
from dictionary
screenshots.description:
Conveniently add words straight from the dictionary with just two clicks.
One can also select specific details to be adding using the suggestions on the right.

screenshots.label:
Kanji overview
(currently only
for Japanese)
screenshots.description:
Divide kanji into groups by criteria such as stroke number or school grade.
Click a kanji to view all its details, include stroke order and containing words.

screenshots.label:
Review session
(Answering)
screenshots.description:
Items get scheduled for review according to the chosen spaced repetition scheme.
The answer gets typed by default, but one can also switch to flashcard mode.

screenshots.label:
Review session
(Solutions)
screenshots.description:
After answering, the correct answers are shown and the item moves to another level.
One can also manually choose a level, ignore the answer or modify the item.

screenshots.label:
Review session
(Results)
screenshots.description: At the end, one can view statistics and all incorrectly answered vocabulary items.

screenshots.label:
Customizing
review sessions
screenshots.description: One can e.g. switch to flash-card mode or prioritize low-level vocabulary items.

screenshots.label: Statistics
screenshots.description:
The table at the top shows the number of items added/reviewed for each language.
The diagrams at the bottom illustrate the numbers over the last days or months.

screenshots.label: Writing notes
screenshots.description:
One can write arbitrary notes and organize them into groups and subgroups.
Basic styling, enumerations and links are supported using markdown syntax.

screenshots.label: Shortcuts
screenshots.description: Common procedures (such as adding words) can be done quicker using shortcuts.
